name: Location! Location! Location! Quiz | The Bible | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where is the book of the Bible that contains the prayer of the Levites located?
questions.explanation:
Nehemiah.

	The book of Nehemiah has 13 chapters and 406 verses. Nehemiah was the author of his own book of the Bible. The prayer of the Levites can be found in Nehemiah 9:4-33. The book of Nehemiah is the last of the historical books of the Old Testament and spans twelve to fifteen years.

questions.text: In what book of the Bible was the parable of the boiling pot located?
questions.explanation:
Ezekiel.

	The book of Ezekiel has 48 chapters and 1,273 verses. The parable of the boiling pot can be found in Ezekiel 24. Ezekiel was the author of his own book which spans approximately twenty-two years.

questions.text: Which is the book of the Bible that speaks of a man's children and home destroyed through a different set of circumstances?
questions.explanation:
Job.

	The book of Job is the first of the four poetical books of the Bible. Job has 42 chapters and 1,070 verses. The book of Job has also been called doctrinal. The writer of the book of Job is uncertain. People have speculated that the author could have been Elihu, Moses or Job. As for the time period that Job's book took place, it is uncertain.

questions.text: Where is the Bible verse, 'A wise son maketh a glad father, but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother' located?
questions.explanation:
Proverbs.

	The book of Proverbs contains 31 chapters and 915 verses, and this verse is Proverbs 10:1. Proverbs is the fifth poetical book of the Bible. Proverbs is often attributed to King Solomon, King David, and King Lemuel.

questions.text: Locate the book of the Bible that speaks of "a time for everything" (NIV).
questions.explanation:
Ecclesiastes.

	Ecclesiastes contains 12 chapters and 222 verses. The famous passage beginning "There is a time for everything" starts in Ecclesiastes 3:1. Ecclesiastes is the fourth of the poetical books and was written by King Solomon during his time away from God.

questions.text: In what book of the Bible is the location of King Saul's attempted murder of David?
questions.explanation:
I Samuel.

	I Samuel contains 31 chapters and 810 verses. In the Latin Vulgate, I and II Samuel are known as I and II Kings while I and II Kings are known as III Kings and IV Kings. The two books of Samuel are considered a biography. A span of 115 years is covered in the first book of Samuel from his birth to the death of Saul.

questions.text: Where is the book of the Bible located that tells of Balaam's donkey speaking?
questions.explanation:
Numbers.

	The book of Numbers contains 36 chapters and 1,288 verses. The donkey speaks in Numbers 22. The book of Numbers is the fourth book of the Pentateuch. Numbers represents the service and walk in a believer's experience. Forty years is spanned from the beginning of Numbers to the last chapter. Moses is traditionally regarded as the author of Numbers.

questions.text: Locate the part of the Bible that speaks of the miracle of the five loaves and two fish.
questions.explanation:
The Gospels.

	All the Gospels together have 89 chapters and 3,779 verses. While the four Gospels have several miracles and events in common, each Gospel has miracles and events known only in that particular book. The loaves and fishes are discussed in Matthew 14, Mark 6, Luke 9, and John 6.

questions.text: What was the location in the Bible that told of God burying Moses somewhere in Moab?
questions.explanation:
Deuteronomy.

	Deuteronomy has 34 chapters and 958 verses. Moses's burial is in Deuteronomy 34. The book of Deuteronomy is the last book of the Pentateuch. The book of Deuteronomy is traditionally credited to Moses and spans 40 years.

questions.text: In what book of the Bible is the death of David located?
questions.explanation:
I Kings.

	The book of I Kings includes 22 chapters and 816 verses. David's death was in chapter 2. I Kings spans 120 years from the first chapter to the last. Either Jeremiah or Ezra is traditionally credited with writing the book of I Kings.
